qas.question: WHat is the earliest surviving use of the clan name of the polish knights?

answers.text: documentation regarding Raciborz and Albert's tenure

qas.question: WHn did the knightly genealogiae associate with heraldic devices?

answers.text: Middle Ages and in the early modern period

qas.question: The polish anem and cry ritualized what?
In 1244 the power to command and army had been used to do what?

context: The <a0_0>documentation regarding Raciborz and Albert's tenure<a0_0/> is the earliest surviving of the use of the clan name and cry defining the honorable status of Polish knights. The names of knightly genealogiae only came to be associated with heraldic devices later in the <a1_0>Middle Ages and in the early modern period<a1_0/>. The Polish clan name and cry ritualized <a2_0>the ius militare,<a2_0/> i.e., the power to command an army; and they had been used some time before 1244 to <a3_0>define knightly status<a3_0/>. (Górecki 1992, pp. 183–185).
